description: The Trump administration's new policy requires US universities to screen foreign students for support of American and Western values and check for hostility to the US or its allies. Indian students, a significant group in the US, face increased ideological scrutiny alongside visa challenges. This screening involves background checks and reporting to federal agencies, affecting admissions and campus diversity. The policy is part of wider educational reforms linking federal funding to ideological alignment, raising concerns about academic freedom and economic impact.

However, Pakistan's foreign minister stated the unveiled plan was not their original draft.

Concerns include uncontrolled data access, unmonitored user actions, and unverified software security, potentially allowing adversaries persistent access and misuse of classified information.

Jurel credited extensive visualisation and discipline for his readiness, also acknowledging mentorship from England's Joe Root.

title: Yom Kippur synagogue attack in UK: Has Europe normalised Jew hatred — again?
description: Europe promised that such hatred would never return. But history does not move in straight lines. On Yom Kippur 2025, in Manchester, glass crunched again. Not on shopfronts, but beneath the wheels of a car that rammed into Jews outside their synagogue, followed by a stabbing rampage.

Abhishek was unable to attend due to national duty, representing India A against Australia A, where he unfortunately registered a golden duck, underscoring the sacrifices athletes make for their sport.

title: Nafisa Ali Sodhi’s grandkids help her cope with hair fall amid chemotherapy - see Pic
description: Veteran actor Nafisa Ali Sodhi, 68, is bravely battling Stage 4 peritoneal cancer, resuming chemotherapy with a positive outlook. She recently shared a heartwarming moment where her grandchildren lovingly helped her with hair loss caused by the treatment. This touching post garnered immense support and admiration from netizens, who hailed her as a warrior.

title: UPSC Essentials | Mains answer practice — GS 1 : Questions on role of Savitribai Phule in advancing women’s education and earthquakes (Week 122)
Is Taylor Swift’s ‘Cancelled’ about Blake or Brittany Mahomes? Fans debate
description: Taylor Swift’s new song “Cancelled!” from The Life of a Showgirl is sparking intense fan debate. The sharp lyrics about loyalty and public backlash have listeners questioning whether Swift is singing about longtime friend Blake Lively or new pal Brittany Mahomes. Social media is split as fans analyze every line for clues about the track’s true inspiration.

description: Congress expressed doubt over "Operation Sindoor," citing conflicting statements from top defense officials and demanding clarity. Air Force chief Amar Preet Singh dismissed Pakistan's claims of downing Indian jets as "Manohar Kahaniyan," while India had shown evidence of damage to Pakistani targets. Earlier, CDS General Anil Chauhan had acknowledged initial Indian losses during the conflict.

description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced Haryana's conviction rate doubled to 80% under new criminal laws, targeting three-year case disposal post-2026. In Kurukshetra, he launched development projects, praising the state's BJP government. Later in Rohtak, Shah unveiled plans for 75,000 new dairy cooperatives, crediting the Modi administration for significantly boosting the khadi sector and India's dairy growth.

Wayne Gretzky & Janet Jones: from ‘Dance Fever’ to 30+ years of marriage
description: Hockey legend Wayne Gretzky and Janet Jones' enduring love story began with a chance meeting in 1981, reigniting at a 1987 Lakers game. Their shared mindset led to a whirlwind romance, a "royal wedding" in 1988, and a family of five children. They prioritized family, making their decades-long marriage a true victory off the ice.

description: Dhruv Jurel marked his maiden Test hundred with 125 runs against West Indies in Ahmedabad, dedicating his century to the Indian army and his fifty to his father. title: Cough syrup deaths: Centre issues advisory; what test results of samples reveal
Trump proposes 15% cap on international students: Enrolment dips; budgets strain
description: The US is already seeing a sharp drop in international student enrolment ahead of a proposed 15% cap, with visa delays and restrictive policies deterring applicants. Asian and African student numbers have plunged, particularly at the graduate level, hitting research programmes and university budgets. Institutions like DePaul are cutting costs amid falling revenues. The proposed cap, paired with a 5% per-country limit, formalises a trend already underway, risking major economic and academic repercussions.

title: Taylor Swift’s ‘Opalite’: Love letter to Travis Kelce leaves fans mesmerised
description: Taylor Swift’s Opalite is more than a song, it’s a love letter to fiancé Travis Kelce. Inspired by his opal birthstone, the track blends heartbreak, healing, and devotion into a chorus about finding “opalite skies.” Fans can’t stop swooning over the way Swift sings about Kelce’s eyes and the life they’re building together. Oh, to be loved by a poet!

title: Who's next in line of fire? Kishor's graft bombs add twist to NDA's Bihar campaign

While leaders deny charges, Kishor claims proof. The state BJP has retaliated, accusing Kishor of funding irregularities.

The Federal Reserve has reduced interest rates by 0.25% and plans further cuts, aiming to stabilise the market amidst stagnation, rising costs, and technological changes, potentially boosting hiring prospects.

description: Maria Sharapova refused to retire after her serious 2008 shoulder injury, driven by her profound love for tennis and her family's immense sacrifices. Despite missing nearly a year and her ranking plummeting, she made a remarkable comeback in 2009, winning a title and rapidly climbing the ranks. Her persistence stemmed from building her career from scratch.

title: Why Indira didn’t let Rajiv attend two proposed meetings with Bhindranwale
description: A new book highlights how political interference and missed opportunities allowed Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale to escalate tensions before 1984. Indira Gandhi's attempts for Rajiv to secretly meet Bhindranwale failed twice due to safety concerns, infuriating him. These cancellations, coupled with his quick 1981 release, led to the tragic 1984 events.

title: Stefon Diggs posts cryptic message as Nicki–Cardi feud pulls him in
description: NFL star Stefon Diggs has finally broken his silence amidst the Cardi B-Nicki Minaj feud, but not in the way fans anticipated. Despite being trolled over Cardi B's pregnancy and Nicki Minaj's controversial remarks, Diggs used Instagram to showcase his fashion and a song, signaling his focus on the upcoming season.
